answers.answer: I would see a chiropractor.  A chiropractor works on the nerves and bones.  Your spine could be out of alignment or it could be that the vertabaes are too close together and it is affecting your nerves.  The nerves in your spine lead to your arms, legs, neck everywhere.  Your spine is your foundation.  The chiropractor can fix the carpel tunnel also.

Hello,I don’t think it is related to carpal tunnel syndrome.As you are having such symptoms on the whole right side,so it is definitely not physiological but pathological. As it is on right  side of the body means that there may be an abnormality in the left side of the brain.It can be a neurological pathology like motor neuron disease,TIA or stroke or autoimmune condition like multiple sclerosis in which the immune system attacks the central nervous system (CNS), leading to demyelination.It can be diagnosed by MRI brain and MRS of the brain.Other possibilities are vit B12 deficiency,diabetes(already ruled out in your case) , hypothyroidism, hypoparathyroidism or peripheral nerve trauma or compression.If there are symptoms only on the right half of the body,it means a right side pathology of the brain.So I feel that clinical evaluation from a neurologist is necessary to rule it out.Hope it helps.Take care and pls do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: ok in november i got sick feelin at work dizzy and lost time for about 5 mins i even went home early and i never do that. ever since then my whole right side  feels different . had a EMG on my right hand dr said carpal tunnel so i am wearinga brace and he wants me to have surgery. but my leg feels the same  and at times my eye shuts for no reason. he dont seem to listen to me says my arm is carpal tunnel. i feel its something differsnt why would both arm and leg start feeling like this all of a sudden. my body feels differnt sinc ethis happen i am not the same. i am scared and i feel my doctor is not listening to me.what should i do?
title: dont know whats going on with me
